moves.2... d5: Black didn't fall for the bait.
moves.4. Nc3: I think white had lost this game!
moves.4... Qxd4: Probably one of black's best moves!
moves.5. Qxd4: I think i can see where white is heading
moves.5... exd4: What else can one expect black to do?
moves.6. Nxe4: Now that was quite an ingeneuos way of getting control over the center!
moves.6... Bb4+: Black may as well make use of the the pawn on d3! No c3 for white!
moves.7... Bxd2+ 8. Nxd2: That was what we all expected
moves.8... Nf6: Now black's position is getting stronger.
moves.9. O-O-O: But not as strong as white's position.
moves.9... O-O: Wimp or maybe we can say safe!
moves.14. Ne5: White is seriously on the go here
moves.14... b6: Black is not one to be left behind
moves.15. Nc6: I think white has something on its mind!
moves.17... Nb8: That is rather a weird waY OF ATTACKING THE KNIGHT! Surely Bb7 would have been wiser!!!
moves.18... Re6: Black wants it to go its own way
moves.19. f5: OOOOh will black fall for the back rank mate!
moves.21. Re8+: White is back on its feet!
moves.22... a5: I don't think black could think of a move at this point!
moves.23. Rxb8: White on the verge of completey thrashing black!
moves.25. f6: But the best is too easy for white!
moves.26... bxc5: Well I guess white wants to get rid of those pawns!
moves.30... d3: Black seems to have an oppurtunity
moves.31. Ke4: White has either given up or become extremely witty!
moves.32... c1=Q: Black must be rejoicing; unaware of the consequences!
moves.33. Nf8#: Cheeky old white!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Fun game though!
